newsitem.title: USA: US WCoast light crudes under pressure from NYMEX.
newsitem.headline: US WCoast light crudes under pressure from NYMEX.

text.p: U.S. West Coast light crudes came under pressure from the September NYMEX sell-off, but differentials were unchanged as traders waited for pipeline nominations in California and Canada.
Alaska North Slope (ANS) crude fell around 40 cents from early trade, finishing 60 cents off Monday.
Major refiners confirmed they had bought enough crude for the month, with one rumored to be flush enough to offer a cargo.
Deltas for ANS remained $1.95 under September West Texas Intermediate.
